instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
PPBUS
Pp3v42 
SMC Reset 
PM SLP S4 L

all ok

U1950 Voltages are erratic. I get them but it dies down randomly. Fan Spin also random

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: Cleaned and re installed U1950 . Getting all voltages when there is fan spin. Voltages drop to zero when fan stops. (U1950)

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: It goes upto 200 mAh then goes down to zero once when the fan stops and then i get max fan spin and Amp Draw is stuck at 240 mAh

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
Any history available?
Pin 3/U1950 goes high?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
No History.
Yes Pin 3 goes high when fan is spinning

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: What about PLT_RESET_L?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: PLT_RESET_L IS 0V

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
What about CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and CPU_VR_READY?
If good, then heat PCH with quality flux.

First be sure, all voltages from page 11 are there.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
U1930 / c1930 / r1931 missing on the board. 

Repairs have been done previously. Should we install them first ?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: Of course; PCH requires CPU_VCCST_PWRGD...

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
Reconstructed all the Missing Points around U1930.
 Now i get PLT_RESET_L  at 3.3V.
Pin 3/U1950 stable at 3.4V

CPU_VCCST_PWRGD IS 1V
CPU_VR_READY IS 0V. The fan stops spinning as soon my probe touches R1955 Pin 2.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
CPU_VR_READY is a very sensitive test point.

Do you get USB activity now?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: My usb tester just went bad a couple of days ago. A new one will come in a week. I dont have a usb with led to test. But i get a constant fan spin.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: You can use a bootable pendrive with LED link.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: I have light on the ssd when connecting a external ssd.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: Just steady power LED, or flashing Link LED too?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: Flashing too.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
Try PRAM reset, should bring chime on.
Internal Caps Lock LED should also react.
Check external video too.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: PRAM reset did nothing .

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message: Is it repairable?

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
If the Link LED of USB HDD flashes, there should be USB activity.
I hope you check that correctly.

You may have accumulated crap underneath PCH.
Heat to burn it...

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
Further inspection revealed that R5177/8 were missing on the board. Reconstructed that area.

Did a PRAM reset - but nothing.
 PRAM Reset makes the fan stop. 
On/OFF key toggle makes the Fan on/off.

threads.title: Macbook 820-00165 Fan Spins
threads.message:
Do you still get PLT_RESET_L high?
Tried to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath PCH?
